pageContext.claim: “You can't have them tied up in the backseat of a car or a truck or a van. They open the door, they look. They can't see women with tape on their mouth or three women whose hands are tied.”
pageContext.analysis: Mentioning women trafficked with tape over their mouths has become a standard part of Trump’s talking points on the need for a border wall. But human-trafficking experts and advocates for immigrant women have said they are perplexed by this tale in Trump’s repertoire — and are at a loss for where he got his information. No prominent news reports have detailed a case that matches the president’s description. (The New York Times reported on March 1 it had found some instances of women being duct-taped and trafficked across the border, but “If the president was suggesting that such savagery occurs daily on America’s southern border, then he was indeed exaggerating.”)
